Dawn comes softer than a sleeping breath
Your dream runs through the forest now
You wake up and stir to find the light
If you have lost it, I will find it for you
It is hidden in our future
Now if we joined hands
we would go far away without letting go
In the memory of a far off day
the story of the blue country bloomed
Shining eyes
Your singing voice
Let us share it
Wolf and Enticing Traveler
This is amazing!
I could watch this all day!
We ended up doing this after all, huh.
Though from here, it does not look like the city's having any particular problems.
Even when wolf packs are having a violent war over territory,
the forest looks as calm as it always does from a distance.
Even you cannot tell with your eyes or ears from afar?
See them over there?
The tax on the goods they are shipping is ridiculously high,
and they are saying they do not want to hand over the goods at the original price.
Something or other about the price per head.
A hostage tax, huh?
Good cargo might as well be hostage to the owner of the river.
The town is in heavy dispute because of the Northern expedition being canceled.
You should be happy you can even get paid.
The cancellation of the Northern expedition is having effects even here, huh.
If you want, you can bet on the meeting outcome with your furs.
There are at least four other groups of people having similar discussions.
Taxes too high.
Northern expedition.
How imports are trending in the city.
Ah.
The wine you just ordered is not for me,
but for yourself, is not it?
I am getting drunk on wine, but something else is making you drunk.
You need money to drink wine,
but thinking of ways to make profit is free.
But we have not just been idly chatting.
One or two mugs for the possibility of me lending you help in earnest is a cheap price.
It is as you say.
Well, you really do look like you are having fun when you talk about business.
I will take that face as an appetizer.
Impossible!
Someone like me, in this state after wine of that grade?
Well, you are probably tired from the journey too.
Rest for a while.
Do not worry.
I am too expensive.
No one will want to buy me.
That is not what I mean.
Rest well, princess.
Are you open?
I just finished patching up the hole.
Look!
I want to look till I bore another hole through it.
Really?
Whenever a hole appears in my apron, everyone stops looking at my face and just stares at the apron.
Everyone is just being careful.
They are afraid if they look at your beautiful face too much, they will bore a third hole into your nose.
That is too bad.
If I had three, it would be easier to tell apart customers that smell bad.
How am I, then?
Traveling customers really do catch onto jokes differently.
So, will it be a drink?
Or food?
Could I get two of the tail dishes packaged up for me?
Right now the chef's preparing food for the dock workers...
Do not worry about it.
I am not in a hurry.
In that case,
how about having a drink while you are waiting?
Sounds good.
Traveling merchants who come to a bar at this time of day have one objective in mind, right?
Before that, let me pay...
I just noticed in passing,
but there is a lot of merchants hanging around the city entrance, are not there?
Ah,
the ones selling furs and fur-related merchandise.
Furs?
The furs, I guess.
Half of them are merchants who have come here from faraway countries hoping to sell it.
The other half are selling tools and wares needed to process the fur into other goods.
And you probably want to know why they are all hanging around there, right?
Right now, the higher ups of the town are deciding whether or not to allow fur to be sold.
This Fifty-man meeting thing?
Right, that.
While that is going on, fur trade is prohibited.
That being the case, all the craftsmen are not sure whether to buy the goods needed to process fur or not.
What is the reason they are deliberating over its sale in the first place?
I heard it is because the Northern expedition was canceled.
The people who would buy up fur in bulk are all gone...
That is right.
Usually I would have a lot more customers here.
Could not they just sell their fur to the merchants at the city gates?
They are all pretty stingy.
Knights and mercenaries on the other hand are quite generous.
Sometimes I even receive fancy clothes like the noblewomen wear as gifts.
Of course, they are very expensive.
But the cost of furs before they are made into clothes is ridiculously cheap.
If they are not sold and made into clothes, the city's income will drop quite a bit.
You got it!
But any barmaid in town can tell you that.
Pretend you did not hear what I am about to tell you.
Of course.
I think that in all likelihood, they will prevent the merchants outside from purchasing the fur.
Even though they know it will anger the craftsmen and the fur handlers.
What is your source for this?
Who knows?
Patrons will always leave a good bar drunk.
I would be nice if you were the same.
The drink will be hitting me pretty soon.
The tail dish is done!
Okay!
By the way,
do you have a wife?
She has not gotten a hold of my purse yet,
but she has a firm hold over my reins.
She must be a good person.
That is too bad.
Those contain furs, huh.
Those do too.
And those.
And those.
At any rate,
the amount of money involved here must be huge.
You are not allowed.
You cannot sell my tail.
I am not a hunter.
Your face says you are ready to sell anything that can be sold.
That is not true.
For instance, I would not try to sell a strawberry growing on the side of the road.
I buy goods from one person and sell to another.
That is an unbreakable principle.
So, what gossip have you heard about this time?
This time it is another exceptionally interesting story.
Oh right.
Want to play a game?
A game?
If you can figure out what kind of animal and what part of it this is using just your nose,
I will let you have anything you like for dinner.
Oh really.
Do you remember those merchants who were hanging around the town entrance?
There has to be a reason for that.
They would not be waiting around like that if there were not.
Most likely, they think that at the end of the meeting,
foreign trade will continue to be barred.
You are not thinking of opening the package, are you?
Of course not.
Figure it out?
Wait.
Back to the subject,
there is no mistake some major political power is pulling strings in the background.
Some western merchant organization known for clothing materials?
A big company trying to attain a monopoly in the fur business?
At any rate...
Lawrence.
Figure it out?
I think guessing would not go well under your conditions.
You are supposed to say that before you start.
Well that is true, but...
So?
Your answer?
I do not know the name,
but it is the tail of a rodent with a big, flat tail.
That is why I said it would not go well.
You knew?
When we came to this town,
I had an uneasy feeling because I could not place this smell.
But not anymore.
My memories of it came back.
The game was really whether I could stop myself from crying from the nostalgia.
Did you do it on purpose?
Do you think I would take advantage of someone is goodwill?
You are always taking advantage of people.
I will never forget this scent either.
Me neither.
It smells fishy coming from you.
Sorry.
Are you that troubled?
With the money from Kumerson, you could easily set up a shop.
Yes, that is true, but...
I have no right to stop you.
If you are not worried, why not relax a bit?
I want to.
You are right.
That is also true.
Roads to the north?
Yes.
There was little snow this year.
It should not be too difficult.
I am heading towards Niohira.
You are purposely going to the heathen lands?
But I guess that is what a merchant does.
Go anywhere to fill their bag of money.
But when we die in the end, we throw away that bag.
Then why do you labor for it?
To obtain it, just to throw it away?
You do not ask the same question when you clean your home.
Very well.
Will you be leaving soon?
No.
I think I will stay until the Fifty-man meeting ends.
If you left now, you would probably make it halfway there on your horse before that.
Though it would be better if you rode a long-haired breed instead.
There is one in the stable, is not there?
Its owner is a man from the north.
He should know the road conditions well.
His name?
Name?
He is long stayed here, but I have never asked his name.
Though I remember him growing fatter with the years.
I see.
These things happen as well.
I will mention you if I see him.
Thank you.
But if you stay for the Fifty-man meeting, you might regret it.
Will it go on that long?
There are many trends in a man's life.
So in a town where many lives gather, there must be trends.
I think it is a trend of man to fight fate.
If I commit a sin, I will repent like a man.
Hard to object to that.
This is your third night here?
What is your name?
Craft Lawrence.
Harold Ekrund.
When I was younger, I would burn out the night talking.
But these days I enjoy my quiet nights.
That is most important.
For me it was the fifth night.
You would talk to him sooner than you would me, Harold?
My first talk with you was on your fifth night, huh?
But it is rare for you to talk.
You.
Yes?
Shall we have a chat?
You have some business with Rigolo, right?
Yes.
I am taking this.
Good night.
What a waste to warm this wine.
You seem to be wary of me.
Can I ask why?
Because female merchants are rare.
If one were to talk to me, I would be more cautious than usual.
These few years, no one's ever seen through me.
This morning, we passed each other outside the inn.
My companion's animal-like instincts picked up on it.
I cannot fool a woman's intuition.
Though I cannot say so myself.
I feel the same way every d-
My name is Fruhl Boland.
But I cannot let my name restrict me.
For business, it is Abe Boland.
I am Craft Lawrence.
Craft?
Lawrence?
In business, it is Lawrence.
I am Abe.
I do not like the Boland much.
Also,
I know how my face looks to a man when I use make up and put up my hair.
And I do not like the praise.
I see.
If I could hide it, I would hide it,
but I am not as modest as I might seem.
I am a talker, if I say so myself.
I will brag about how I am actually quite sociable.
Your sociability is gradually making an impression on me.
But,
we have not exchanged anything but short greetings.
I cannot see why you have taken to me.
One reason is that old man Harold's taken to you.
That geezer's got good eyes for people.
Though he is reserved and unsociable.
And his favorite phrase is,
Next year I will go on a pilgrimage.
What about your companion?
My companion?
Yes, your companion.
She is a woman.
You do not see many merchants with female companions.
Well, there is quite a bit about my companion.
Of course, I do not mean to pry.
You two look like you have traveled quite a bit, and you do not seem to be bound by money.
So I thought that I could talk to you.
Well, that is how it was,
but to come out of the blue with How about we make some small talk?
It is not like I could just say that.
So I used Rigolo's name,
but it was not just a way to pull you out here.
You want to meet Rigolo, right?
Yes.
May I inquire as to your reasons?
I have heard that Rigolo is this town's chronicler.
I want to see records of old stories of this town.
That is quite a strange reason.
I thought for sure you wanted to talk about furs.
Of course, I am a merchant.
It would not hurt to have some information about that too.
But it is dangerous,
and my companion does not wish for that.
He does have a mountain of books passed down through the generations in his study,
and it does seem like his dream is to pass his days reading them.
He wants to retire from being the scribe at the Fifty-man Meeting.
Really?
There is no end to the people who want to get close to him.
If you went to see him now, he would probably just glare at you and turn you away.
I am trading with the Church in this town.
I have quite a relation with them.
And usually Rigolo writes things for the Church.
Because of that connection, we have known each other for a long time.
Merchant Lawrence.
I do not know if you are a great man or whatever,
but you do seem a bit different from the rabble around us.
It is very kind of you to praise me,
but can you wait a little longer before we shake hands?
You are not the kind to have sweaty palms.
You have been wearing that unreadable mask for some time now.
Then instead of asking about what you trade, can I ask something else?
Go ahead.
What would it cost to introduce me to him?
I do not need money or anything.
But...
How about you chat with me?
What, I am not lying.
You may think it strange,
but to me, having someone to talk to without needing to hide my gender,
especially another merchant, is worth more than Lima gold coins.
Then it is worth less than Lumione silver.
I am a merchant.
Either way, money is most valuable.
But,
I do not know what kind of person your companion is.
If I could, I would like to talk to her,
but when someone gives you the cold shoulder, wine tastes bad.
I do not think she would.
You sure?
There is nothing you can understand less than a woman's heart.
And I do not understand woman talk anyway.
Well, I am here to do business.
If it works out, I would like someone to talk with.
I may not look it, but I am
A talker and a sociable person.
Yes, that is right.
As long as my companion does not get envious.
That is a difficult condition.
